review_title: Teammates are good, management is cliquey
pros: Relatively good pay. Most technicians are nice and willing to help. Pharmacists are cool with technicians, little to no ego-differences between pharmacists and technicians. Higher management is nice, albeit relatively absent.
cons: Middle management is super cliquey and have ginormous egos; they stay in their offices all day, only come out for huddle, and answer your questions coldly. Seem to not like the technicians at all, even though the tech manager got promoted only a year ago. Recognition from higher management seems rehearsed, but they are nice enough.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Plano, TX
pros: Its a job i guess - free and easy parking - so many opportunities to move up i got asked to be CNO less than 6 months of working as a new grad (but this is barley a pro)
cons: - Nurse residency contract ( forcing new grads to pay if they want to leave because they don't like the crappy job) - Messy environment and nurses are expected to keep things clean - tons of verbal orders - Old ancient meditech software - Pay (they actually paid me wrong by the hour and i had to check them) - Terrible ratio expect the max everyday - they call you on your days off asking random questions

pros: Nothing is a pro for working here.
cons: Please run as far as possible from Medical City Plano. It is a terrible Laboratory to work for. Managers complain if you take a 15 minute break during a 10 hour shift, you are overworked and underpaid for the amount of work you have. There are a few decent people, but most will talk bad about you behind your back. Very cutthroat even if it doesnt seem like it. I left the laboratory field entirely after this job and thinking about going back gives me anxiety. Please do not work here if you value your mental health.

job_title: New Grad Nurse Residency in Plano, TX
pros: Coworkers are amazing! Level of patient acuity ensures you're learning new things frequently and hones skills. The doctors are great and willing to teach and answer questions.
cons: Staffing is terrible. Administration doesn't seem to listen to nurse concerns resulting in continual unsafe situations. Experienced nurses are fleeing quickly for safer staffing and much higher pay. HCA is not concerned with nurse retention in any immediate way. The solution to staffing problems is more and more new grads, international nurses, RAC nurses, and travelers.

pros: Nothing about this place is good. Completely miserable here
cons: Super cheap about everything. Most equipment not working. Constantly having to look for supplies/equipment on other units which is a huge waste of time when you’re already behind due to a horrible patient to nurse ratio- super unsafe for nurses and patients. Always understaffed with RNs and PCTs. Passive aggressive bullying as well. A lot of favoritism. Do not listen to staff complaints/concerns and just use it against you making you scared to ever speak up about anything at all.

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Plano, TX
pros:
Availability or opportunities to pick up hours.

Can be flexible.
cons:
Critically understaffed. Several technicians have quit over the last year, and they were never replaced. However, 2 new technicians were recently hired. I think they're still short by 4, maybe 6 technicians, including IV technicians.

2-4 of the staff understand all the processes to completion in the pharmacy, so if you happen to be working at a time when only 1 or 2 of those staff are working, you get behind waiting for instruction.

Despite the understaffing, management and peers expect tasks to be completed without delays/overtime, despite extra duties.

Cliques or favoritism aren't exactly rampant, but it absolutely exists in management, staff, and between pharmacists and technicians.

review_title: Great place to work. Everyone are so nice and helpful.

pros: People are great, only reason I stayed

pros: Get with the right team and the teamwork is great. New CNO making good changes.
cons: The entire company tends to work lean.

pros: 401 K matches $1 for dollar up to 3% initially, and then increases every 5 years. Short term disability policy is free and helpful if you have to have surgery.
cons: They pay below average for the area. I received a huge raise after leaving my position there. Unfortunately, the management there is terrible which is the true problem. They manage by intimidation from the bottom on up straight to the CNO. They like to say they are a Magnet Facility, but in reality they don't treat their nurses that way. I worked there for over 10 years and in the end had to leave because I found them to be a very unethical organization that cares less about their patients than they do about their profits. Unfortunately HCA as a whole cares very little about their employees or longevity. They cut benefits and pay with very little notice or an apology. I can't recommend this hospital as an employer if you'd like to be treated well or prefer to work for an ethical organization that rewards nurses for advocating for their patients.

pros: Good to gain experience, lots of different types of patients, good tuition reimbursement, some learning opportunities
cons: Takes FOREVER to get decisions made (over a year to move a linen cart), administration makes lots of promises and fulfills very few, willing to write you up for small mistakes in favor of government initiatives instead of what's right for the individual patient- even tried to write me up for something I documented PRIOR to receiving education to document otherwise......  I've heard they've realky declined SEVERELYsince I've left, especially the 7th floor- favoring young nurses (who lack appropriate experience) for management.....

pros: The people I work with are the best part of working here. Theyre great to work with!!!
cons: Administration has such a chokehold on the rest of the hospital staff.  For a magnet hospital, they really don't care about nurse input to improve patient care. They only care about how much money they can make and how fast people can be moved through their system. The acuity and volume are very high but staffing and pay are low.

pros: Worked on unit that was team oriented Best Manager at TMCP. Great co workers. Great Hospitalists. Most MD's are kind and considerate and will listen to suggestions given by RN
cons: Poor benefit package and expensive. No upper management support. Salary below average for North Texas. No communication from MD to MD making job less effective for nurse. Waste valuable time trying to get info from other depts. including surgery.ER not cooperative with nursing units. short triage time but long wait time to see physician. Many days 12hr shift with no lunch break but must clock out for 30 min to make it look like you had a break
